728554f-a.title: Richmond: Bay Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
728554f-a.text:
Bay Street, south from Vnderbilt Avenue. On the left are
tracks and shops of the Staten Island Railroad. Spanning the street
is a new bridge, which was comstructed to eliminate a street-level
railroad crossing at Edgewater Street.
June 28, 1934
P. L. Sperr

728562f-b.text:
Bay Street (left), north froa Vanderbilt Avenue,
showing, between the east side of the avenue and the Upper
Bay, the tracks of the Staten Island Railroad and the begin-
ning of operations on grade crossing elimination. The
view is from the end of the station platform.
May. 1,1331

the left are shown buildings of the United States Marine

728555f-a.text:

728558f-c.title: Richmond: Bay Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
728558f-c.text:
Bay Street, west side, at Vanderbilt Avenue. The view
is south across part of the new site of the United States
Marine Hospital,formerly the Vanderbilt estate. This is the
western portion of the hospital site and is nearer Tompkins Avenue.
June 7, 1931
L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Anotker view in the same direction. Vanderbilt Avenue
runs scross the face of the view from right to left, directly
in front of the houses.
June 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
1)
The hospital site near Vanderbilt Avenue and Talbot Place.
The house in the center is No. 100 Vanderbilt Avenue at the
corner of Talbot Place.
June 13, 1931
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
